description: News and reaction to the impact of coronavirus on the Bailiwick of Guernsey and other top stories.
title: Coronavirus: Guernsey updates and other news 21-25 September
title_page: Coronavirus: Guernsey updates and other news 21-25 September - BBC News
maintext:
Anyone wanting a postal vote for Guernsey's first island-wide general election has until midnight to register.
At least 20,000 people have signed up for a postal vote for next month's election - that is six times as many as signed up at the last election in 2016.
It is the equivalent of two thirds of the 31,000 people registered to vote, with many feeling it offers them the chance to take more time deciding where to put their marks on the ballot paper - with each voter able to cast up to 38 votes.
The States of Guernsey reminded the public that if they end up not posting their vote, they can still bring it to a polling station.
Anyone wanting a postal vote can register online at www.election2020.gg.
